metadata.feature_description: Set content as master template for reuse across multiple module instances

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Make Master option via Module Actions

steps.action: Navigate to Home page with HTML modules in Edit mode
steps.expected: Page displays with multiple HTML modules visible
steps.actual: Page displayed correctly with multiple HTML modules in edit mode

steps.action: Click on Admin menu in Module Actions for an HTML module
steps.expected: Module Actions menu displays with 'Make Master' option
steps.actual: Admin menu displayed with options: Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, Refresh - NO 'Make Master' option found

steps.action: Click Settings to explore module configuration options
steps.expected: Module Settings dialog opens with master content options
steps.actual: Settings dialog opened but did not display full settings interface - only showed module content preview

issues: The 'Make Master' option is not visible in the Module Actions menu for standard HTML modules on their native page
Code review reveals the option only appears when a module is 'orphaned' (its master page was deleted or doesn't exist)
The stated UI Location 'Module Actions > Make Master' appears to be inaccurate - the option appears as a contextual link within the module content area, not in the dropdown menu

observations: Code review confirmed Master Content Template feature exists in: MakeMasterPage.js, HtmlTextProController.cs (MakeMaster API endpoint), and HtmlModule.ascx.cs
The 'Make Master' functionality is conditional - it only appears when IsOrphanedModule() returns true (when masterTab is null or deleted)
For modules on their native page, the 'Make Master' option is intentionally hidden as they are already on their master page

To test this feature would require: (1) Creating an HTML module on Page A, (2) Sharing/copying it to Page B, (3) Deleting Page A or the module from Page A, (4) Then the 'Make Master' link would appear on Page B
The feature appears designed for recovery scenarios when modules become orphaned from their original master page, not for routine content management

The documented UI location 'Module Actions > Make Master' does not match the actual implementation - the link appears inline within the module content with the message: 'This module does not belong to the page, but its master page is not found. Make this page as master?'
